result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amadeus D McClain

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
10/24 rescheduled due to Court not being available.

11:23 AM  Defendant Amadeus D McClain not in court.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
Matter set to address GPS issues.
Defendant received notice of this date in person at the 9/13/22 date. 
BTC: No appearance, Bench Warrant requested/ordered, bond forfeited. STAYED 3 DAYS.

11:45 AM Defendant Amadeus D McClain in court.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court.  Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
Court goes through GPS violations outlined in RCAP report and addresses the fact that the defendant has brought his children in to court again. 
Defense requests bond not be modified today and gives statement. 
State indicates that he believes the children are here so the defendant does not get taken in today and makes statement outlining concerns. 
Defense responds. 
BTC: BOND MODIFICATION: 22CF350 will be converted back to cash. 

***DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY***

10:32 AM Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Amadeus D McClain in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for Amadeus D McClain. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Defense has a global offer, has reviewed it with his client who is rejecting the offer and requests speedy trial in 22CF350.
State indicates the offer is no revoked. 
Court holds colloquy with defendant about rejecting the offer. 
Defendant rejects offer. 
Atty Samuels indicates he still hasnt been able to review all of the discovery but the defendant wishes to enter speedy today. 
BTC: 22CF350 set for JT and FPT with the remainder tracking as status.

Defense just got the digital discovery for the new cases, requests status in 45 days still needs a global for all 4 cases. 
State will send global by the end of the week.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Atty Jeremy Samuels
Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

2:07 PM Prosecuting attorney Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Amadeus D McClain appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove appeared in court for Amadeus D McClain. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 17, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Initial appearance on February 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
